title: Petit Coeur 2015 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: This is a soft wine with light caramel flavors as well as strawberry fruitiness. It has a smooth texture and feels generous and warm. With its light, almost off-dry aftertaste, the wine is good as an apéritif.

title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)
description: This wine shows the tropical side of Sauvignon Blanc with pineapple and nectarine fruit and generous acidity. It does have a crisp mineral character that gives texture to the wine. Drink now.

title: Vignobles Fontan 2015 Domaine de Maubet White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: A classic local blend that is dominated by Ugni Blanc and Colombard, this is a deliciously crisp, lively wine. It has juicy kiwi fruit as well as citrus giving a refreshingly zesty wine that is ready to drink.

title: Vignobles Fontan 2015 Lou Campagno Red (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This is a bright wine with 90% Merlot. It has black-currant crispness and acidity. The tannins are light and the wine, ready to drink young and fruity, will be best slightly chilled.

title: VillaViva 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Thau)
description: There's a subtle earthy funkiness to this 100% Carignan-based rosé, with supporting notes of white cherry, currant and strawberry hull. The light-weight palate offers decent acidic lift and finished short but clean.

title: Viña el Aromo 2012 Private Reserve Merlot (Maule Valley)
description: Gritty and earthy up front, with generic plum scents, this feels hard, tannic and in need of more body. Roasted, oaky flavors of hickory and saucy plum finish dry, woody and hollow.

title: Trenel Fils 2015  Beaujolais-Villages
description: Banana aromas give this wine its fruity character. It has red fruit along with a strong layer of acidity. It is light in texture finishing with a fresh fruity aftertaste.

title: Sanguinhal 2015 Sottal White (Lisboa)
description: An off-dry wine, perfumed with Moscatel giving apple and spice flavor that is delicate and refreshing. Crisp and clean, it is bright with acidity at the end and ready to drink.

title: Latah Creek NV Huckleberry D'Latah White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Medium-pink in color, apple and berry aromas are followed by spritzy, moderately sweet fruit flavors. It goes down easy.

title: Le Grand Noir 2015 Black Sheep Rosé (Pays d'Oc)
description: Made from 85% Grenache and 15% Syrah, this is a straightforward and easygoing rosé that offers notes of ripe strawberry and cherry on the nose and mouth. The light-weight palate offers ample acidity and a pleasant astringency that lends some texture through the close. Drink now.

title: La Colombina 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: This has a nose of mint, blue flower and berry while the simple diluted palate offers hints of fresh strawberry and white pepper. It's easy drinking, with bright acidity and frail tannins.

title: Chilensis 2013 Reserva Estate Bottled Merlot (Maule Valley)
description: Raw, earthy plum aromas are spicy and lightly herbal. This feels saucy yet monotone. Tomato, red-plum and herbal flavors end with a hint of brown sugar and a continuation of the wine's herbal plum character.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)
description: This light and fruity wine has fresh acidity as well as lemon and ripe pear fruits. It is soft, smooth, and with a creamy texture, is very ready to drink.

title: Château de Pizay 2015  Beaujolais Blanc
description: Still rare to find in Beaujolais, this Chardonnay is a light wine, full of fruit and attractive ripe melon flavors. It has enough acidity for balance while being more ripe than fruity. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Calmel & Joseph 2015 Villa Blanche Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)
description: Delicate herbal accents add depth to the fruity tones of apple flesh, pear and white nectarine. The palate is surprisingly round and toasty, with rich baked apple and peach pit flavors that fall somewhat flat on the midpalate. Drink now.

title: Bonacchi 2014 Il Selciato  (Rosso di Montalcino)
description: This has aromas of stalky underbrush, porcini mushroom, game and berry. The wine's uber-simple palate shows suggestions of wild cherry and a hint of clove alongside drying, fleeting tannins and brisk acidity.

title: Oak Grove 2013 Family Reserve Merlot (California)
description: Smooth and soft, this easygoing wine has mild fruit and oak-spice flavors, low acidity and a touch of sweetness to round off any edges.

title: Replica 2015 Misbehaved Pinot Noir (California)
description: With an extra-deep color and smoky-sweet oak aromas, this wine doesn't taste like its peer group, but seems to be going for commercial appeal as a spiced-up generic red. It's full bodied, almost thick in texture and firmly tannic.

title: Pinuaga 2013 Nature Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Compost, rubber and stalky berry aromas come through the nose to the mouth. The palate is tight and tannic. The finish is narrow, hinting at stalky berry aromoas.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Hayes Valley 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Extremely ripe pear and Gravenstein apples grow toward white peach and generic stonefruit flesh on the nose of this bottling. Strong apple flavors meet with yellow pear on the slightly sweet-seeming palate.

title: Kenos 2013 Cabernet Franc (Cachapoal Valley)
description: Briary plum and minty oak aromas lead to a sharp palate with high acidity. Tart flavors of red plum and currant blend with spice and tomato notes in front of a saucy, high-toned, high-acid finish.

title: Laroque 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne)
description: Notes of red currant, rhubarb, tart strawberry and Cherry Dr. Pepper grace the nose and mouth of this straightforward and easy-drinking red. It's lightweight and softly structured, with a short but clean and pleasant finish.
region_1: Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne

title: Donkey & Goat 2014 The Gallivanter Red (California)
description: Smoky and earthy in aroma, tart and tannic in the mouth, this is an assertive, mouth-puckering wine.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2015 Periquita Rosé (Península de Setúbal)
description: There is enough crispness to make this ripe wine tight and fruity. Its dry strawberry fruitiness comes with a light touch of pepper. Drink now.

title: Badger Hound 2013 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: This is a full-bodied, intensely ripe wine, slightly sweet-tasting like soda, that benefits from a balance of tangy acidity and a finish of leather.

title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Terra Iconia  (Beaujolais)
description: Produced from vines around the hilltop village of Oingt (claimed to be the most beautiful in France), this has a soft texture, a banana flavor and light acidity. It is the sort of wine that will be better slightly chilled.

title: Malk 2014 Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: This is a tank-fermented wine from the King's Ridge Vineyard overlooking the Pacific Ocean. A big, intense expression of the variety, it's burly in black fruit and proffers a taste of coconut macaroon.

title: Bonacchi 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Simple and earthy, this has aromas suggesting red berry, truffle and forest floor. The lean, diluted palate offers suggestions of cherry and orange zest alongside brisk acidity and frail, loose-knit tannins.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Bigode Branco White (Lisboa)
description: This fruity wine has bright acidity and a perfumed character. With its crisp texture, it is full of lemon and green apple fruit. Drink now.

title: Domaine de Ménard 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Dark colored for a modern rosé, this is a ripe blend of two Cabernets, Syrah and Tannat. Red fruits and a rich texture make for a wine that is almost sweet in character, certainly floral and perfumed. Drink now.
